title: Thomas Frosch - FOIA -U.S. Navy -  Blue Angels Navy flight demonstration squadron

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) for Thomas Frosch , Captain (Retired)
Request copy of history of assignments NAVPERS form 1070/605, Legion of Merit award citations, Meritorious Service medal citation, Distinguished Flying Cross Citation, Navy commendation medal citations, Air Medal award citations, all award citations, Cumulative Record of Training (NAVPERS Form 5300/16), Adminstrative remarks NAVPERS 1070/613, dates of promotions. Please redact any sensitive personal information per FOIA Exemption 6.

VETERAN INFORMATION
Name of veteran: Thomas Frosch
Branch of service: United States Navy
Rank: Captain O-6
Service Dates:  1992 to 2018
https://militaryhallofhonor.com/honoree-record.php?id=229601

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

title: Joseph Clay Kent  - U.S. Army - FOIA

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A releasable copy of the OMPF concerning Joseph Clay Kent, Chief Warrant Officer, dates of service approx 1998 to 2018. 
OMPF request includes: Discharge DD-214, Assignments and Geographical locations DA form 2-1, Military Education/training courses, Enlisted Record Brief, Bronze Star Medal award citations, Army commendation medal award citations, all Unit award citations, Badges, list of all Awards and Decorations, administrative remarks and all award citations on file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley
